metadata.description: Architectural definitions for social systems, organizations, and human networks
metadata.purpose: Enable modeling of social structures, influence propagation, collaboration networks, and organizational dynamics
key_references: Social Network Analysis: Methods and Applications (Wasserman & Faust)

agent.definition: An individual or collective entity (person, organization, group) that has agency and forms relationships
characteristics: Can be individual or collective (person, team, organization, nation)

relationship.definition: A connection or tie between agents representing social interaction, affiliation, or influence

friendship.strength: measured by frequency of interaction, emotional closeness

influence.definition: One agent affects decisions or beliefs of another

trust.direction: directed (A trusts B ≠ B trusts A)
trust.example: Alice trusts Bob with sensitive information

affiliation.example: Alice is member of Engineering Department

transaction.example: Alice buys products from company B

relationship_properties.strength: weight representing intensity, frequency, or importance
relationship_properties.multiplexity: multiple types of ties between same agents

capability.definition: Skills, resources, or functions that an agent can perform

level_0.name: System Classification
level_0.purpose: Identify the social system scale and type

interpersonal_network.description: Small group of individuals with direct relationships
interpersonal_network.example: Friend network, family tree, research collaboration group

organizational_network.description: Formal organization with departments, teams, roles

inter_organizational.example: Supply chain network, industry ecosystem, alliance network

society.example: National society, global trade network, social movements

level_1.name: Primary Structure
level_1.purpose: Identify major groups, departments, or communities

inferred.definition: Relationship inferred from patterns or context

centrality_measures.description: Metrics identifying important or influential nodes

degree_centrality.formula: C_D(i) = number of edges connected to node i

betweenness_centrality.definition: Frequency of being on shortest paths between other nodes
betweenness_centrality.formula: C_B(i) = Σ (σ_jk(i) / σ_jk) where σ_jk is shortest paths from j to k

closeness_centrality.definition: Average shortest path distance to all other nodes
closeness_centrality.interpretation: High closeness = efficient access to information
closeness_centrality.formula: C_C(i) = 1 / Σ d(i,j) where d is shortest path distance

eigenvector_centrality.interpretation: High eigenvector = connected to influential nodes
eigenvector_centrality.example: PageRank is a variant of eigenvector centrality

community_detection.description: Identify clusters or groups within network

modularity_optimization.method: Maximize modularity Q (density of edges within communities)

label_propagation.method: Nodes adopt labels of their neighbors iteratively
label_propagation.use_case: Fast community detection in large networks

diffusion_models.description: Model spread of information, influence, or behavior

independent_cascade.mechanism: Activated nodes have one chance to activate neighbors

linear_threshold.mechanism: Node activates when weighted fraction of neighbors exceeds threshold

network_evolution.description: Model how networks change over time

preferential_attachment.mechanism: New nodes connect to high-degree nodes (rich get richer)
preferential_attachment.result: Scale-free networks with power-law degree distribution

exponential_random_graph_models.purpose: Explain network structure via local mechanisms

structural_validation.purpose: Verify network has expected topological properties

attribute_homophily.purpose: Check if similar agents connect more often

metrics.name: density
metrics.measurement: Fraction of possible edges that exist

metrics.name: average_path_length
metrics.measurement: Average shortest path between all pairs

resilience.definition: Network maintains connectivity under node/edge removal

metrics.name: robustness_to_failure
metrics.measurement: Network stays connected under random removal

diversity.definition: Variety of agent types and connection patterns

cohesion.definition: Strength of group unity and clustering

small_world.definition: High clustering + short average path length
small_world.implication: Information spreads quickly despite local clustering
small_world.example: Six degrees of separation, social networks

scale_free.definition: Power-law degree distribution (few hubs, many low-degree nodes)
scale_free.implication: Robust to random failure, vulnerable to targeted attack

structural_holes.definition: Gaps between groups bridged by individual broker
structural_holes.implication: Brokers gain information and control advantages

missing_bridge.definition: Two communities should communicate but have no connections
missing_bridge.example: Engineering and Marketing departments don't communicate despite need
missing_bridge.implication: Missing communication channel or liaison role

structural_hole.example: Only one person connects two divisions
structural_hole.implication: Fragile dependency, opportunity for new broker

unexplained_influence.definition: Agent B changes behavior but no direct connection to influencer A
unexplained_influence.detection: Behavioral change without path from known influencer
unexplained_influence.example: Employee adopts practice without visible exposure
unexplained_influence.implication: Missing indirect influence path or hidden relationship

information_paradox.definition: Agent has information but no observable source
information_paradox.detection: Knowledge appears without incoming information edge
information_paradox.example: Person knows rumor but no friend told them

incomplete_transitivity.definition: A→B, B→C exist but A→C missing despite expectation
incomplete_transitivity.detection: Low clustering in network with high triadic closure expectation
incomplete_transitivity.example: Friend of friend should be friend, but isn't
incomplete_transitivity.implication: Hidden conflict, missed opportunity, or data gap

Organization.definition: Formal institution with structure and purpose

Role.definition: Position in social structure (independent of person occupying it)

complex.network_pattern: Dense, adaptive networks with feedback loops
